meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something) by force or scheming.
meanings.sent1: The new king supplants the old ruler by seizing power.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the evil sorcerer supplants the kind wizard as the most powerful being.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat supplants the dog as the favorite pet in the household.
meanings.sent4: The rising star supplants the veteran actor in the lead role of the play.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox supplants the lion as the king of the jungle in the fable.
